reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have only just been reading reviews of hotels on this site this year, so this is why its a little late my review.
reviews.title: Outstanding Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this Hotel in September 2011 when it was new. Great Staff and service. A very odd lay out with the check in desk on the first floor. The rooms was very clean and beds good to sleep in. A down side it was hot but they gave us a fan.
reviews.title: Cant fault it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location with tesco express on the main road and next door to a pub which has full food for sale as this hotel don't do any food.
reviews.title: Good overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I am planning to return very soon.
reviews.title: Brilliant budget hotel - but too noisy (even on weekdays)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Got a room for a Friday night in the Travelodge sale for £10! For this cannot fault it!
reviews.title: Good budget hotel, shame about the noise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: stayed here for one night for our daughter's graduation. Rooms were basic but clean and provided a decent night's sleep - heard no noise from outside the hotel. Check in was very slow, but this was our only slight quibble and was probably due to the volume of people arriving at the same time.
reviews.title: serves a purpose.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was more than adequate for the price paid. Don't expect 5 star luxury and you won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: Impeccable clean room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is a fairly new travelodge and what we have come to expect, nice fixtures but their new bathroom layout for the disabled is excellent. We stayed for 4 nights at £10 per night which cannot be beaten. Service was good any request made to reception was met with a smile. Staff very pleasant. Comfortable bed slept well. Near the hotel just round the corner their is a Tesco express which opens 6am till 11pm everyday. There is a indian restaurant further up king street called mogulls try and catch happy hour monday to thrusday 6.30 - 7.30 where it is only £5 to sit in for a curry with rice or nan bread. Please note no alcohol allowed in restaurant. Parking might be a problem as the car park opposite is very small but there are other parking areas close to the hotel. In the pedestrian precint there is a small cafe called the cornish pastie and you can get a full english with tea and toast for £4.50. Wetherspoon is also right next door to the hotel. Lancaster is quite a hilly area just a note worth mentioning to wheelchair users.
reviews.title: Not the Ritz - but clearly good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Recently stayed here for 5 nights in a family room at an unbeatable price of £19 per night (without breakfast). It's a no-frills hotel, but it's new, clean and very central. Service was good - we needed an extra pillow and a hair-dryer and that was no problem at all. The reception is on the first floor; access to floors with rooms is only with your keycard - it feels safe. There's no fridge in the room and internet access is extortionately expensive (£5 for one hour, £10 for a day and £20 for a week). The coffee-place downstairs (Pao-Pao) serves one of the best coffees in town and the current wifi-password is printed on every receipt. You'll find a small Tesco's around the corner which is open till 11pm.
reviews.title: Value for money hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a small car-park just opposite the hotel, but during the day it is expensive to leave your car there. Overnight is OK at £1.40 from 6pm onwards. Free parking is about a 5 minutes walk away. I'll be back at the Travelodge next time I'm in Lancaster...
reviews.title: Good Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Warm welcome,quick check in and a swop to a quite room - they'd obviously been asked for ths by others who read these reviews. Spotless room and bathroom, looked newly refurbished and bed very comfortable - pillows usual poor quality sadly. Fab views across to the castle and beyond.
reviews.title: Lancaster Travelodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel central although on a busy corner so traffic noise for those on the front and even in a quiet room you get the nosie from nearby clubs and late bars emptying their bottles quiet. Not too bad the nights we stayed Mon - Wed as the hotel was very quiet itself but can imagine very noisy at weekends.
reviews.title: Superb value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast - a Wetherspoons serving from 8am, cafe next door to Travelodge with range of snacks and Tesco Express next to that.
reviews.title: If you seek value and location without frills, this hotel provides.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other meals - can recommend the White Cross closeby ( 5mins ). By the side of the canal and lovely to sit outside on a nice day. Good food and reasonable prices. Good selection of real ales too.
reviews.title: All you need as a base

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Borough also 5 mins away in Dalton Square. Looks like an gentlemans club from victorian times but serves a great range of drinks including real ales and food. Had an excellent meal here. You go inthe restaurant or eat in the bar or graden area. Friendly,knbowledgeable and welcoming staff.
reviews.title: An excellent practical and convenient hotel with pleasant activities within walking distance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checked in fairly early, asked for and got a quieter room (one facing the inner quad; heard no noise from machinery or the like). A basic Travelodge setup, but clean and just what we expected. Staff seemed nice enough. Overheard complaints the next day about noise from the streets until the early hours, so I guess room location is everything. Very handy for walking into the city. There`s Wetherspoons or a cafe below for breakfast. Car park across the street has about 15 spaces so you need to be lucky (we were); you don`t have to rush out at 8 o`clock in the morning to top up your ticket - you can add an extra hour or two onto your overnight ticket.
reviews.title: Good place to stay if you can get the right room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as it was one of the few to welcome dogs in rooms (£20 extra presumably to cover any extra cleaning). It is in the centre of the city and an ideal place to explore from. Room was spotless and big enough for a one night stay - we were put at the end of a corridor so it was quiet and on first floor so not too far up stairs with the dog! It is on the A6 so expect some traffic noise but that is the norm in cities! Parking is not ideal as we had to pay for overnight and then get up before 8am to pay again but there are other car parks nearby and safe on street parking 5 mins away. Does what it says on the tin!
reviews.title: Excellent for short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amenities standard, but stay away from the rooms bordering the inner quad. The noise of machinery, albeit not owned by the hotel, will drive you nuts. The hotel take no responsibility although they claim to be in talks with their offending neighbour.
reviews.title: Sleepless in Lancaster

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at this Travelodge this week and found it excellent value. It's right in the centre of town and only about 10 minutes walk from the railway station.
reviews.title: Great value and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were spotlessly clean, with crisp white bedding and comfortable beds. I have stayed in larger Travelodge rooms, and there was only a shower and not a bath, but for the small sum we paid this place more than lived up to our expectations.
reviews.title: Worst night sleep ever.
